TITLE: Flipped Delivery
DEF: Delivering content outside the classroom, and using in-class time for interactive activities
TASK: The Flipped Lectures pattern leverages the concept of inverting the traditional instructional approach, promoting active learning and boosting student engagement. It involves delivering instructional content through pre-recorded videos or other materials before class, while utilizing in-class time for interactive activities. The pattern's challenges include ensuring high-quality pre-class materials, providing clear instructions, and facilitating in-class discussions. For maximum effectiveness, inclusivity needs to be promoted, catering to students with diverse learning needs.
